creator: George.Lindholm@ubc.ca
text:
My stdout log file keeps filling up with:

May 11, 2004 5:33:21 AM org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket processConnection
INFO: connection timeout reached

They may be useful while debugging, but in a production environment these
messages just hide real problems logged to stdout.

Apache 2.0.49.

   George

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I think the answer is that you should upgrade to a very new JK, which includes
keepalive support. I think the report will be invalid as soon as JK 1.2.6 is out.

I'm using 1.4.2_04.


The problem is actually caused by the connectionTimeout value set in
the Connector definition (not quite intuative, but that's what debuggers
are there for).

I'm setting it to connectionTimeout="0"
creator: George.Lindholm@ubc.ca
